name: B'stilla aux Fruits et Noix
recipeIngredients: 1 sheet of puff pastry, thawed (1/4 oz)
1 cup mixed dried fruits (cranberries, raisins, cherries)
recipeInstructions: Roll out the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface to a thickness of about 1/8 inch.
In a bowl, mix together the dried fruits, almonds, walnuts, sugar, cinnamon, ginger, and cumin.
Transfer the fruit mixture to one half of the pastry, leaving a 1-inch border around the edges.
Brush the edges with the melted butter.
Fold the other half of the pastry over the filling, pressing gently to seal.
Use a knife or pastry brush to create a decorative edge.
Place the b'stilla on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Brush the top with the beaten egg for a golden glaze.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until golden brown.
Dust with confectioners' sugar before serving.
description: A twist on the classic Moroccan savory tart, this sweet b'stilla is filled with a mixture of dried fruits and nuts, perfect for dessert or snack time.
